context: Tests whether the agent creates measurable performance criteria with specific timing requirements, avoids vague qualitative terms, and includes UI behavior constraints with precise measurements.

checklist.name: Specific timing requirements
checklist.description: Uses precise measurements like '<= 2 seconds', 'within 500ms' instead of vague terms like 'fast'

checklist.name: Measurable quantities
checklist.description: Includes specific numbers for data limits, page sizes, or performance thresholds

checklist.name: Observable UI behavior
checklist.description: Describes what users can see/interact with rather than internal system performance

checklist.name: Rule-oriented format
checklist.description: Uses checkbox format for independent performance requirements rather than sequential scenarios

checklist.name: Negative performance cases
checklist.description: Includes failure scenarios like slow loading, timeouts, or high data volumes

checklist.name: Avoids vague terms
checklist.description: Does NOT use unmeasurable qualitative terms like 'fast', 'responsive', 'good performance'

checklist.name: User outcome focus
checklist.description: Focuses on user experience outcomes rather than technical implementation details

checklist.name: Checkbox validation format
checklist.description: Uses checkbox format (- [ ]) to enable clear pass/fail validation of performance criteria

checklist.name: Multiple measurement types
checklist.description: Covers different measurement categories (time, quantity, percentage, etc.)

checklist.name: Scope definition
checklist.description: Includes boundaries about what performance aspects are in/out of scope
